meanings.sent1: She tends to stretch her arms in the morning.
meanings.sent2: He tends to extend his hand to help others.
meanings.sent3: The cat tends to stretch out lazily in the sun.
meanings.sent4: The river tends to extend its banks during heavy rains.
meanings.sent5: The flower tends to stretch out towards the sunlight for growth.

meanings.definition: A ballet movement in which the leg is extended forward or backward from the body
meanings.sent1: During the ballet class, they practiced tendus across the floor.
meanings.sent2: The ballet dancer performed beautiful tendus during the recital.
meanings.sent3: The tendus of the ballerina made the audience smile.
meanings.sent4: Her tendus were like graceful swans gliding on water.
meanings.sent5: The tendus of the dancer were precise and elegant, captivating the audience.
